intro: Noccaea papyracea, commonly known as the paperweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax, giving them a distinctive appearance. Noccaea papyracea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy environments.
